data.text: Wisdom has built a house for herself,
She has killed her beasts;
She has sent forth her servants,
Whoso is foolish, let him turn aside to me:
Come, eat of my bread,
Leave folly, that ye may reign forever;
He that reproves evil men shall get dishonor to himself;
Rebuke not evil men, lest they should hate thee:
Give an opportunity to a wise man, and he will be wiser:
The fear of the Lord is the beginning of wisdom,
For to know the law is the character of a sound mind.
For in this way thou shalt live long,
Son, if thou be wise for thyself, thou shalt also be wise for thy neighbors;
He that stays himself upon falsehoods, attempts to rule the winds,
For he has forsaken the ways of his own vineyard,
And he goes through a dry desert,
A foolish and bold woman, who knows not modesty,
She sits at the doors of her house,
Calling to passers by,
saying,
Take and enjoy secret bread,
But he knows that mighty men die by her,
But hasten away, delay not in the place,
For thus shalt thou go through strange water;
But do thou abstain from strange water,
That thou mayest live long,
